meanings.def: to express or explain your thoughts or feelings clearly in words
examples: She struggled to articulate her thoughts.
It is the school’s duty to articulate its practices to parents.
She cannot articulate her feelings very well.
You need to articulate clearly what you are trying to achieve.

meanings.def: to speak, pronounce or play something in a clear way
examples: He was too drunk to articulate properly.
articulate something Every note was carefully articulated.
She spoke slowly, articulating each word clearly.

meanings.def: to be related to something so that together the two parts form a whole
examples: These courses are designed to articulate with university degrees.

meanings.def: to be joined to something else by a joint, so that movement is possible; to join something in this way
examples: articulate (with something) bones that articulate with others
articulate something a robot with articulated limbs

meanings.def: good at expressing ideas or feelings clearly in words
examples: He was unusually articulate for a ten-year-old.
She is the most articulate critic of government policy.
The teachers help the children to be more articulate about their strengths and weaknesses.
All we could hear were loud sobs, but no articulate words.
